meanings.definition: In a manner that is pretentious or affected.
meanings.sent1: She walked hammily into the room, tossing her hair dramatically.
meanings.sent2: He spoke hammily, using big words to impress everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat hammily strutted around the house, pretending to be royalty.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches swayed hammily in the wind, as if performing a dance.
meanings.sent5: The child imitated the teacher hammily, trying to sound important.

meanings.definition: To act in a showy or ostentatious way.
meanings.sent1: She hammily flaunted her new dress at the party.
meanings.sent2: He hammily showed off his expensive watch to his friends.
meanings.sent3: The magician hammily waved his wand, pretending to perform magic.
meanings.sent4: The peacock hammily displayed its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent5: The actor hammily exaggerated his gestures on stage for the audience.

meanings.definition: To speak or behave in an exaggeratedly theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: She hammily recited her lines in the school play.
meanings.sent2: He hammily acted out a scene from his favorite movie.
meanings.sent3: The toddler hammily pretended to be a roaring lion, entertaining his family.
meanings.sent4: The politician hammily gestured to the crowd, trying to win their support.
meanings.sent5: The singer hammily belted out the high notes, captivating the audience.
